com.brianmearns.crafter

Interface Builder<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.google.common.base.Supplier<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ListBuilder, ListBuilder.DefaultListBuilder, ListBuilder.NeverListBuilder, MapBuilder, MapBuilder.DefaultMapBuilder, ValueBuilder

    public interface Builder<T>
extends com.google.common.base.Supplier<T>
    A Builder implements the builder design pattern, in which one object is used to construct instances of a particular type, after being setup step by step with values to transfer to the built instance.

    This interface extends the Supplier interface but does not define any additional methods on the interface. This is meant primarily as a tagging interface, used to indicate the intention of the implementing class to be a builder. The Supplier.get() method defined by the Supplier interface is the one that should actually build instances.

    Builders are typically characterized by a fluent, chainable function interface, in which each configurable property of the object to be built has a method for setting its value in the builder, and that method return the builder itself back for chaining.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get()
      This is the method that should actually build and return an instance of type T, based on the current configuration of this Builder object.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        This is the method that should actually build and return an instance of type T, based on the current configuration of this Builder object.
        Specified by:
        get in interface com.google.common.base.Supplier<T>
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of type T.
